clinical_study.brief_title: Benefit of Left Atrial Roof Ablation in Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study is to assess whether left atrial roof ablation adds any benefit in the arrhythmia-free probability after paroxysmal atrial fibrillation ablation.

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from atrial arrhythmias without antiarrhythmic drugs

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from atrial arrhythmias with or without antiarrhythmic drugs
Presence of any complications in the acute phase or during follow-up

arm_group.description: Pulmonary vein encircling by performing continuous radiofrequency lesions surrounding each ipsilateral pulmonary vein antrum

arm_group.description: Pulmonary vein encircling by performing continuous radiofrequency lesions surrounding each ipsilateral pulmonary vein antrum plus creation of a radiofrequency line joining contralateral superior pulmonary veins throughout the left atrial roof.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Drug-refractory paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypo or hyperthyroidism
- Implantable defibrillation or pacemaker implanted
- Moderate or severe mitral valve disease or mitral prosthetic valve
- Ejection fraction less than 30%
- Left atrial anteroposterior diameter more than 50 mm.
- Previous atrial fibrillation ablation
- Left atrium thrombus
- Current infective disease or sepsis
- Pregnant women
- Current unstable angor
- Acute myocardial infarction in last 3 months
- Atrial fibrillation secondary to ionic disturbance, thyroids disease or secondary to any other reversible or non cardiovascular disease
- Reduced expectancy of life (less than 12 months)
- Patient participating in another clinical study that investigates a drug or device
- Psychologically unstable patient or denies to give informed consent
